item.name: Horn of the Commander
entries: This horn has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend a number of charges up to your Proficiency Bonus (minimum of 3) to cast the {@spell Summon Warrior|J:Humanoids} spell. For 3 charges, you cast the spell at 3rd-level. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

ac.special: 12 + the level of the spell + 2 (Sentry only)

hp.special: 30 + 10 for each spell level above 3rd + 10 (Berserker Only)

trait.name: Magical Origin
entries: The spirit is immune to the effects of the {@spell hold person|XPHB} spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atkr ms, rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} magical piercing damage.

action.name: Greataxe (Berserker Only)
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d12 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} magical slashing damage.

action.name: Halberd (Sentry Only)
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 10 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} magical slashing damage.

bonus.name: Warrior's Frenzy (Berserker Only)
entries: The spirit takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and gains advantage on its next attack roll on the current turn.

bonus.name: Trickster's Feint (Scoundrel Only)
entries: The spirit takes the {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Help|XPHB} action. An attack roll aided by this Help action deals additional damage equal to twice the spell's level on a hit.

reaction.name: Sentinel's Strike (Sentry Only)
entries: When a creature the spirit can see enters its reach or makes an attack against a creature other than the spirit while within its reach, the spirit can make a special opportunity attack.

trait.name: Humanoid Swarm
entries: As a group of humanoids, the swarm has the following effects:

items: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature. In addition, the swarm is immune to spells and magic effects that would alter its size.
While the swarm is not {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it has advantage on all saving throws.

If the swarm is missing hit points another creature within 5 feet that shares a tag (other than Swarm) with the swarm can use its action to merge into the swarm, destroying itself and restoring a number of hit points to the swarm equal to five times its CR.

trait.name: Lines and Squares
entries: The phalanx can use half its movement to reshape itself from a 10-foot square into a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line or vice versa.

trait.name: Hold the Line
entries: Creatures smaller than the phalanx cannot enter its space unless it lets them or a magic effect specifically allows them to. A creature can attempt to force its way in using a {@action Shove} action. The phalanx has advantage on the contested check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phalanx makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Pikes and Spears
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage or {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage if the phalanx is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Javelins
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage if the phalanx is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Pike Wall
entries: When a creature moves into the reach of the phalanx's Pike attack, the phalanx can use a reaction to make a Pike attack against that creature. If the creature is Large or larger, the phalanx has advantage on this attack.

variant.name: Humanoid Swarms
entries: At the DM's discretion, a swarm may have one or more additional traits providing some varity. This trait might represent aleigence to a particular faction, the racial makeup of its members or even just a little extra flavor. Some examples are included below.

items.name: Arcane Warriors
entries: The swarm knows a cantrip of the DM's choice that has a casting time of 1 action. If the swarm has the Multiattack action, it can replace one attack with a casting of the cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma (DM's choice) is the swarm's spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

items.name: Arsonists
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to ignite a flamable object, or 10-foot section of a structure, within 5 feet of it.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to make breath weapon attack in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma modifier) or take PBd10 damage of one of the following types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.

items.name: Darkvision
entries: The swarm has darkvision out to 60 feet.

items.name: Enhanced Movement
entries: The swarm has a climbing or swimming speed equal to its walking speed.

items.name: Heavily Armoured
entries: The swarm has a +2 bonus to its AC, however, its speed is reduced by 5 feet.

items.name: Large
entries: The swarm is composed of at least some Large creatures. The swarm's size category is increased by one and it can move through and opening wide enough for a Large creature.

items.name: Resistance
entries: The swarm has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

items.name: Rip and Tear
entries: When the swarm hits a creature in its space with a melee attack, that creature begins {@condition bleeding|J:General}.

items.name: Small
entries: The swarm is composed of entirely Small humanoids and can move through and opening wide enough for a Small creature.

trait.name: Humanoid Swarm
entries: As a group of humanoids, the swarm has the following effects:

items: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature. In addition, the swarm is immune to spells and magic effects that would alter its size.
While the swarm is not {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it has advantage on all saving throws.

If the swarm is missing hit points another creature within 5 feet that shares a tag (other than Swarm) with the swarm can use its action to merge into the swarm, destroying itself and restoring a number of hit points to the swarm equal to five times its CR.

action.name: Sidearms
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}51 ({@damage 8d10 + 7}) slashing damage or {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) slashing damage if the battalion is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Slings and Arrows
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 8d6 + 7}) bludgeoning or piercing damage or {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning or piercing damage if the battalion is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Fire Volley (3/Day)
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of a point the battalion can see within 150 feet must make a Dexterity saving (DC equals 8 + PB + Dexterity modifier) or take {@damage 7d8} bludgeoning or piercing damage and be slowed until the start of the unit's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is only hampered for the duration instead,

reaction.name: Fire at Will
entries: When a creature the battalion can see ends its turn within 150 feet of the battalion but not closer than 30 feet, the battalion can make a ranged weapon attack against them.

variant.name: Humanoid Swarms
entries: At the DM's discretion, a swarm may have one or more additional traits providing some varity. This trait might represent aleigence to a particular faction, the racial makeup of its members or even just a little extra flavor. Some examples are included below.

items.name: Arcane Warriors
entries: The swarm knows a cantrip of the DM's choice that has a casting time of 1 action. If the swarm has the Multiattack action, it can replace one attack with a casting of the cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma (DM's choice) is the swarm's spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

items.name: Arsonists
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to ignite a flamable object, or 10-foot section of a structure, within 5 feet of it.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to make breath weapon attack in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma modifier) or take PBd10 damage of one of the following types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.

items.name: Darkvision
entries: The swarm has darkvision out to 60 feet.

items.name: Enhanced Movement
entries: The swarm has a climbing or swimming speed equal to its walking speed.

items.name: Heavily Armoured
entries: The swarm has a +2 bonus to its AC, however, its speed is reduced by 5 feet.

items.name: Large
entries: The swarm is composed of at least some Large creatures. The swarm's size category is increased by one and it can move through and opening wide enough for a Large creature.

items.name: Resistance
entries: The swarm has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

items.name: Rip and Tear
entries: When the swarm hits a creature in its space with a melee attack, that creature begins {@condition bleeding|J:General}.

items.name: Small
entries: The swarm is composed of entirely Small humanoids and can move through and opening wide enough for a Small creature.

trait.name: Humanoid Swarm
entries: As a group of humanoids, the swarm has the following effects:

items: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature. In addition, the swarm is immune to spells and magic effects that would alter its size.
While the swarm is not {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it has advantage on all saving throws.

If the swarm is missing hit points another creature within 5 feet that shares a tag (other than Swarm) with the swarm can use its action to merge into the swarm, destroying itself and restoring a number of hit points to the swarm equal to five times its CR.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warband makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Spears and Axes
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing or piercing damage or {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing or piercing damage if the warband is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.
This attack deals an additional PB damage if the target is {@condition frightened|XPHB} by the warband

action.name: Barrage
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing or piercing damage or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing or piercing damage if the warband is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.
This attack deals an additional PB damage if the target is {@condition frightened|XPHB} by the warband

action.name: Battlecry (3/Day)
entries: The warband lets out a terrifying scream. Up to PB creatures of the warband's choice that it can see within 30 feet and that can hear the warband must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma modifier) or become {@condition frightened|XPHB} by the warband for one minute (save ends).

reaction.name: We are coming for you!
entries: When a creature the warband can see within 60 feet ends its turn {@condition frightened|XPHB} of it, the warband can move up to half its speed towards the creature.

items.name: Bears, Elephants or Rhinos
entries: Once per turn, when the swarm hits a creature with a melee attack, they can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + the modifer used for the attack) or be knocked {@condition prone|XPHB}.

items.name: Boars, Horses or Stags
entries: If the swarm moves at least 20 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting with a melee attack, the attack deals an additional PBd4 damage.

items.name: Crabs, Sharks or Squids
entries: The swarm has a swimming speed equal to its walking speed, can breathe underwater and has advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks while underwater.

items.name: Hyenas, Lions, or Wolves
entries: The swarm has advantage ability checks that rely on hearing or smell. They also have advantage on melee attacks against creatures within its space.

items.name: Rats, Snakes or Spiders
entries: Once per turn, when the swarm hits a creature with a melee attack, they can force the creature to make a Constituion saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + the modifer used for the attack) or be poisoned until the start of the swarm's next turn.

entries: The cavalry makes two weapon attacks.

While the swarm is not {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it has advantage on all saving throws.

If the swarm is missing hit points another mounted creature within 5 feet that shares a tag (other than Swarm) with the swarm can use its action to merge into the swarm, destroying itself and its mount and restoring a number of hit points to the swarm equal to five times its CR.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cavalry makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Lances and Sabres
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) slashing or piercing damage or {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing or piercing damage if the cavalry is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Stampede (3/Day)
entries: The cavalry moves up to 40 feet in a straight line. Each creature whose space the cavalry passes through must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Strength modifier) or take {@dice 5d8} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone|XPHB}. A creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone on a success. A creature that is already prone when it makes the saving throw has disadvantage on the saving throw.

bonus.name: Cross the Field
entries: The cavalry takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage} action.

bonus.name: Scatter the Infantry
entries: When the cavalry hits a Medium or smaller creature with a melee attack, it can force each Medium or smaller creature within 10 feet of the target to make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Strength modifer) or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the target.

variant.name: Humanoid Swarms
entries: At the DM's discretion, a swarm may have one or more additional traits providing some varity. This trait might represent aleigence to a particular faction, the racial makeup of its members or even just a little extra flavor. Some examples are included below.

items.name: Arcane Warriors
entries: The swarm knows a cantrip of the DM's choice that has a casting time of 1 action. If the swarm has the Multiattack action, it can replace one attack with a casting of the cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma (DM's choice) is the swarm's spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

items.name: Arsonists
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to ignite a flamable object, or 10-foot section of a structure, within 5 feet of it.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to make breath weapon attack in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma modifier) or take PBd10 damage of one of the following types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.

items.name: Darkvision
entries: The swarm has darkvision out to 60 feet.

items.name: Enhanced Movement
entries: The swarm has a climbing or swimming speed equal to its walking speed.

items.name: Heavily Armoured
entries: The swarm has a +2 bonus to its AC, however, its speed is reduced by 5 feet.

items.name: Large
entries: The swarm is composed of at least some Large creatures. The swarm's size category is increased by one and it can move through and opening wide enough for a Large creature.

items.name: Resistance
entries: The swarm has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

items.name: Rip and Tear
entries: When the swarm hits a creature in its space with a melee attack, that creature begins {@condition bleeding|J:General}.

items.name: Small
entries: The swarm is composed of entirely Small humanoids and can move through and opening wide enough for a Small creature.

variant.name: Skinchanger Swarm
entries: The swarm is composed of skinchangers, some or all of which are in bestial forms. The swarm's statistics are unchanged, except the DM may choose to change the damage type of their weapon attacks and they gain one of the following benefits based on the most common beast form among them:

items.name: Bears, Elephants or Rhinos
entries: Once per turn, when the swarm hits a creature with a melee attack, they can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + the modifer used for the attack) or be knocked {@condition prone|XPHB}.

items.name: Boars, Horses or Stags
entries: If the swarm moves at least 20 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting with a melee attack, the attack deals an additional PBd4 damage.

items.name: Crabs, Sharks or Squids
entries: The swarm has a swimming speed equal to its walking speed, can breathe underwater and has advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks while underwater.

items.name: Hyenas, Lions, or Wolves
entries: The swarm has advantage ability checks that rely on hearing or smell. They also have advantage on melee attacks against creatures within its space.

items.name: Rats, Snakes or Spiders
entries: Once per turn, when the swarm hits a creature with a melee attack, they can force the creature to make a Constituion saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + the modifer used for the attack) or be poisoned until the start of the swarm's next turn.

trait.name: Humanoid and Beast Swarm

trait.name: Crew the Ship
entries: When the crew uses its action to act as the crew of a ship, it counts as a number of crew equal to 20% of its current hit points (rounded down, minimum of 1).

action.name: Knives and Axes
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning or slashing damage or {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning or slashing damage if the crew is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Slings and Arrows
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning or piercing damage or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning or piercing damage if the crew is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Grappling Hooks (3/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one Large or larger object. {@h}The object is pulled 10xPB feet towards the crew or half as far if the crew is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

If the target is a vehicle and ends this movement within 10 feet of the crew, the target cannot move away from the crew until a creature within 5 feet uses an action to remove the hooks or the crew releases it (no action required).

variant.name: Variant: Crew Actions vs Ship Actions
entries: The current version of this statblock assumes a ruleset in which the ship itself has actions and the crew simply contribute to those actions by numbers alone. If you are not using such a ruleset or the ship does not use its own actions, such as spelljammers, you may wish with to replace the Crew the Ship trait with the folllowing:

entries.name: Crew Actions
entries: While on board a ship they control, the ship crew takes one of the following actions:

items.name: Move
entries: The ship moves up to a number of feet equal to 50% the crew's remaining hit points (minimum of 5 feet).

items.name: Fire
entries: The ship crew loads, aims and fires a weapon mounted on the vehicle. The attack deals additional damage equal to 20% of the crew's remaining hit points (minimum of 1) on a hit.

items.name: Repair
entries: The ship crew touches a component or weapon of the vehicle and restores a number of hit points to it equal to 25% of the crew's remaining hit points (minimum of 1).

items.name: Brace
entries: The crew protects a itself, a creature, or a component or weapon on the ship within 5 feet. Attacks against the target have disadvantage until the start of the crew's next turn.

entries: The swarm is composed of at least some Large creatures. The swarm's size category is increased by one and it can move through and opening wide enough for a Large creature.

items.name: Resistance
entries: The swarm has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

items.name: Rip and Tear
entries: When the swarm hits a creature in its space with a melee attack, that creature begins {@condition bleeding|J:General}.

items.name: Small
entries: The swarm is composed of entirely Small humanoids and can move through and opening wide enough for a Small creature.

trait.name: Humanoid Swarm
entries: As a group of humanoids, the swarm has the following effects:

items: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature. In addition, the swarm is immune to spells and magic effects that would alter its size.
While the swarm is not {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it has advantage on all saving throws.

If the swarm is missing hit points another creature within 5 feet that shares a tag (other than Swarm) with the swarm can use its action to merge into the swarm, destroying itself and restoring a number of hit points to the swarm equal to five times its CR.

trait.name: Crew the Ship
entries: When the crew uses its action to act as the crew of a ship, it counts as a number of crew equal to 20% of its current hit points (rounded down, minimum of 1).

action.name: Knives and Axes
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}50 ({@damage 8d10 + 6}) bludgeoning or slashing damage or {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning or slashing damage if the crew is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Slings and Arrows
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 8d8 + 6}) bludgeoning or piercing damage or {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning or piercing damage if the crew is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

action.name: Grappling Hooks (3/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one Large or larger object. {@h}The object is pulled 10xPB feet towards the crew or half as far if the crew is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

If the target is a vehicle and ends this movement within 10 feet of the crew, the target cannot move away from the crew until a creature within 5 feet uses an action to remove the hooks or the crew releases it (no action required).

variant.name: Variant: Crew Actions vs Ship Actions
entries: The current version of this statblock assumes a ruleset in which the ship itself has actions and the crew simply contribute to those actions by numbers alone. If you are not using such a ruleset or the ship does not use its own actions, such as spelljammers, you may wish with to replace the Crew the Ship trait with the folllowing:

entries.name: Crew Actions
entries: While on board a ship they control, the ship crew takes one of the following actions:

items.name: Move
entries: The ship moves up to a number of feet equal to 50% the crew's remaining hit points (minimum of 5 feet).

items.name: Fire
entries: The ship crew loads, aims and fires a weapon mounted on the vehicle. The attack deals additional damage equal to 20% of the crew's remaining hit points (minimum of 1) on a hit.

items.name: Repair
entries: The ship crew touches a component or weapon of the vehicle and restores a number of hit points to it equal to 25% of the crew's remaining hit points (minimum of 1).

items.name: Brace
entries: The crew protects a itself, a creature, or a component or weapon on the ship within 5 feet. Attacks against the target have disadvantage until the start of the crew's next turn.

variant.name: Humanoid Swarms
entries: At the DM's discretion, a swarm may have one or more additional traits providing some varity. This trait might represent aleigence to a particular faction, the racial makeup of its members or even just a little extra flavor. Some examples are included below.

items.name: Arcane Warriors
entries: The swarm knows a cantrip of the DM's choice that has a casting time of 1 action. If the swarm has the Multiattack action, it can replace one attack with a casting of the cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma (DM's choice) is the swarm's spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

items.name: Arsonists
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to ignite a flamable object, or 10-foot section of a structure, within 5 feet of it.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The swarm can use an action (or replace one attack it makes with its Multiattack action) to make breath weapon attack in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma modifier) or take PBd10 damage of one of the following types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.

items.name: Darkvision
entries: The swarm has darkvision out to 60 feet.

items.name: Enhanced Movement
entries: The swarm has a climbing or swimming speed equal to its walking speed.

items.name: Heavily Armoured
entries: The swarm has a +2 bonus to its AC, however, its speed is reduced by 5 feet.

items.name: Large
entries: The swarm is composed of at least some Large creatures. The swarm's size category is increased by one and it can move through and opening wide enough for a Large creature.

items.name: Resistance
entries: The swarm has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

items.name: Rip and Tear
entries: When the swarm hits a creature in its space with a melee attack, that creature begins {@condition bleeding|J:General}.

items.name: Small
entries: The swarm is composed of entirely Small humanoids and can move through and opening wide enough for a Small creature.

trait.name: Scaling Bonus
entries: The warrior has a Scaling Bonus that it adds to all D20 Tests and save DCs. This bonus equals +1 at CR 3 or higher, +2 at CR 7 or higher and +3 at CR 11 or higher.

trait.name: Shield Wall
entries: Other creatures of the warrior's choice within 5 feet gain an +1 bonus to their AC and to their Strength and Dexterity saving throws. The warrior must be wielding a shield and not incapacitated to grant this bonus. A creature can only benefit from this trait once at a time, even if multiple adjacent creatures have it.
This bonus increases to +2 at CR 7.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atkr mw, rw} {@hit 3 + PB}, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. {@h}{@damage PBd6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atkr mw} {@hit 3 + PB}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage PBd4+ 3} bludgeoning damage and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked {@condition Prone}.

reaction.name: Sentinel's Strike
entries: When a creature the warrior can see enters its reach or makes an attack against a creature other than the warrior while within its reach, the warrior can make a special Opportunity Attack with its Spear.

spell.name: Summon Warrior

m.text: a banner or horn worth 300+ GP

entries: You call forth a humanoid warrior spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the {@creature Warrior Spirit|XPHB} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a form: Berserker, Scoundrel, or Sentry. The creature resembles a Humanoid creature of your choice marked by the chosen form, which determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.
